oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-05-18 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 18, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Faron Young (host/performer), guest performers Rusty & Doug (Kershaw), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Shorty Lavender, the Jordanaires, Millie Kirkham, Stringbean, Minnie Pearl (her first appearance after appearing on 'This Is Your Life'), and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 919th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Faron Young; Rod Brasfield; Rusty & Doug; Shorty Lavender; Jordanaires; Millie Kirkham; Stringbean
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Faron Young -- I'm Gonna Live Some Before I Die (Faron Young) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces Rusty & Doug -- You'll See (Rusty & Doug) -- Prince Albert commercial (Faron Young, Rod Brasfield) -- Faron Young introduces Shorty Lavender -- Bill Cheatham (Shorty Lavender fiddle) -- Faron Young talks -- He Was There (Faron Young, Jordanaires, Millie Kirkham) -- Faron Young introduces Stringbean -- John Henry (Stringbean)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Wood, Del; Minnie Pearl; Jordanaires (Musical group); Kirkham, Millie; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Lavender, Shorty; Young, Faron; Kershaw, Rusty; Kershaw, Doug; Rusty & Doug
